  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZMAT FOUND BY THE UNLOAD WITH DRY WET STAINS. PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE OF A BAG WITHIN A RED TOTE TO STOP LEAKAGE. DescribePack: UPON FURTHER INSPECTION CONATINER 1/3 CONTAINERS WAS FOUND ON ITS BELLY WITH DRY LIQUID AROUND IT. BOTTLE HAD LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS PLACED INSIDE OF BAG WITH RED TOTE AND PLACED UNDER HOOD IN CASE OF HAZARDOUS FUMES

item.title: Report E-2023080372
item.description:
Report E-2023080372

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: BRYAN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LBY experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Shock Chlorinator release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released impacting a 4' x 6' area of the trailer and 2' x 2' area of the concrete lot below due to damaged jug lids. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged jugs, impacted cardboard, and absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080562
item.description:
Report E-2023080562

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint UN3066 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) cups to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ambipar to remediate the impacted surfaces. Ambipar personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive paint-related material-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the one (1) 5-gallon damaged pail was placed in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for terminal disposal.

DescribePack: White streaks were seen on the rim and on the side of the bucket although leakage was not significant. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was placed into salvage drum. Leakage was not spreading.

item.title: Report E-2023080130
item.description:
Report E-2023080130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN3108 Varox DBPH-50 release from (2) 45-pound boxes. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released impacting a 3' x 3' area of the trailer floor due to being crushed as a result of improper loading. The released product and damaged boxes were containerized into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023080597
item.description:
Report X-2023080597

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found after preload was done for the day. Box was wet all over, and the bottle that had a crack inside leaked onto the box, the SDS, the label, and OP-900 causing the labeled to be relabeled and being careful of the OP-900. Box came open because it was soaking wet from the crack in the bottle, but at least the other three bottles were not damaged. The plastic bag still had all four bottles in it, and the liquid still came out. DescribePack: What failed was that the bottle had cracked open spilling everywhere. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors were opened. Fans were on.

item.title: Report E-2023080675
item.description:
Report E-2023080675

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit it was discovered that the load had shifted. The driver became aware of the load shift and stopped on I-80 in Abilene,TX and discovered that one of the poly 5 gallon pail of floor stripper (un1760) had been damaged by other freight and had released 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and clean up of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080617
item.description:
Report X-2023080617

  • City: HEWITT

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer and was found wet and torn. The package was placed in a red hazmat tote and given to quality assurance to be processed. DescribePack: The seal on one of the bottles had failed and was damaged. This caused the contents to leak out and damage the box and leak onto the other bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright into a red hazmat tote.

item.description:

item.title: Report E-2023080326
item.description:
Report E-2023080326

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 26, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralization was confirmed with pH strips, crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All UN1760 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080209
item.description:
Report E-2023080209

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LGT experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid release from boxed containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Several other jugs appeared to also have loose caps, saturating their boxes. A total of 5 boxes of bottles were found damaged and impacted or releasing. The impacted dock area was neutralized with sodium bicarb. All jugs were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted cardboard, absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080178
item.description:
Report E-2023080178

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons pf product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted surfaces. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint related materials release and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails were placed in another 55-gallon drum, and both drums of waste were staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report X-2023080478
item.description:
Report X-2023080478

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: EDINBURG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scan at 0412 on 7/25/2023 at Edin 0785 and placed under the rollers at unload door 6 since it was a misloaded package. At 0700 QA was working on packages in the unload and came across the Item. Outer packaging looked wet damaged, so contents were inspected. Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the inner items had a leak. Package was placed in a yellow salvage drum and secured at QA1 to be processed post sort. DescribePack: Outer package appears wet damaged at the bottom one third / base of the package at one side. Tape closing/securing the bottom of the package is only covering 1/4 of the closure. only 1 of the 4 inner containers appears to be undamaged. 2 items appear dented at their base but have no leak. One inner container is crushed/dented at its base and has leaked over 1/2 of its contents. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: As soon as QA found the package inspection was performed to identify the cause of the wet damage on the outer packaging. When it was found to be caused by the inner contents of the package, item was secured and placed in a yellow salvaged drum and taken to QA1.

  • Description: The tank car was reported leaking by UPRR yard personnel. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. Mgr. Robinson had E3/OMI respond and found the car with an open liquid valve and loose plug. The Spillage was wiped down and the car was secured properly.

item.title: Report I-2023060096
item.description:
Report I-2023060096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-15
  • City: PORT ARTHUR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 17:50 on 5/15/2023 a Kansas City Southern Railway OBA CPKCR employee working in the CPKCR Port Arthur rail yard reported that loaded tank car GATX 7520 (Sulfuric Acid) was leaking from the top of the car. The CPKCR Hazmat Department mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to assess and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, GATX 7520 was inspected by the response contractor and discovered to be leaking from beneath the liquid line fill cap. The vapor line valve end cap was removed and the valve opened to relieve any internal pressure that was present. Once this was done, the leak stopped. The liquid line fill cap was removed and inspected, revealing that the internal gasket was deteriorated. A temporary repair was completed by responders to seal the closure until the following day. The vapor valve and end cap were secured tool tight, and the liquid fill line cap was replaced and secured tool tight. The car was moved to the RIP track and arrangements were made with the shipper to procure a new fill cap gasket. On 5/16/2023 a new gasket was provided by the shipper, and responders, once again, released any internal pressure by opening the vapor line valve end cap and vapor valve. The liquid fill line cap was removed and the new gasket installed. The liquid fill line cap was reinstalled and rendered tool tight. The vapor valve was placed in the closed position and the end plug was also rendered tool tight. Total estimated release was 15 gallons. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report I-2023060089
item.description:
Report I-2023060089

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T00:31:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUCKLEY OIL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver noticed minimal leakage and immediately exited the highway and pulled over away from traffic. Driver called Buckley Oil Company Headquarters and personnel were dispatched to assist. Upon arrival, EH&S and Sales Manager discovered a small amount of product had leaked from a tote and was dripping from the back of the vehicle. Cause of the leak was a damaged Polyethylene Tote leaking product as the vehicle moved. Once the vehicle was stopped, product stopped leaking from the tote. Absorbent pads were used to soak up product from the vehicle to prevent any further dripping onto the ground. Absorbent pads, duct tape and plastic wrap were used to temporarily repair the tote so it could be transported back to Buckley Oil Headquarters for disposal. Oil absorbent was used on the pavement where the product had dripped. Additionally, a small amount of grass and dirt were removed where product had splashed off of the pavement. Photos of the scene are available if necessary.

item.title: Report I-2023020006
item.description:
Report I-2023020006

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T00:33:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-10
  • City: Beaumont
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TIDEWATER TRANSIT CO, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The vehicle was in transit and ran over road debris, resulting in damage to the steering system of the road tractor. The driver lost control and collided with bridge support post. After the collision, the road tractor caught fire resulting in destruction of the road tractor and damage to the tank trailer, A release of material from the tanker did not occur. Environmental cleanup activities involved product transfer from the damaged tanker to a new tanker, clean up of debris, and abatement of a minor motor oil and diesel fuel release from the road tractor of the vehicle. After the fire was extinguished, the product in the tanker was transferred to another tanker. The damaged tanker was trailer #1057.
